test_error_message: junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Expected no warnings or errors
bug_description:
Bug ID: 107
Project: Closure
Bug Type: Semantic Logic, Syntax Error (SL SH SF)

Title: Unhandled Exception during Compilation

Description:

The method "createOptions" in the supplied code has been designed to create compiler options based on the set flags. It produces an error causing the junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Expected no warnings or errors.

Problem:
This error is arising because of the message bundle which is not handling i18n warnings properly when the compilation level is at ADVANCED_OPTIMIZATIONS and no translationsFile has been specified.

The logic is that in this scenario, any instance of goog.getMsg would get renamed, so it's better to inline it and disable i18n warnings as the user didn't ask for i18n. However, the warning level for i18n messages is not set to off, which causes warnings to be thrown and the test to fail consequently.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run the 'createOptions' method with the 'flags' object set such that the 'compilationLevel' property is equal to 'CompilationLevel.ADVANCED_OPTIMIZATIONS' and 'translationsFile' property is empty.

Expected Result:
The method should run without throwing any warnings or errors. If the compilation level is 'CompilationLevel.ADVANCED_OPTIMIZATIONS' and no translations file has been specified, it should set the message bundle to a new instance of 'EmptyMessageBundle' and turn off the i18n warnings.

Actual Result:
The method throws warnings regarding i18n because the warning level for i18n messages has not been set to off in such a scenario.

Solution:
To solve this issue, a line of code needs to be added in the 'else if' part where it handles the scenario mentioned above. The following line should be added:
' `options.setWarningLevel(JsMessageVisitor.MSG_CONVENTIONS, CheckLevel.OFF);` '
This will shut off the i18n warnings when no translations file has been provided and the compilation level is set to 'CompilationLevel.ADVANCED_OPTIMIZATIONS'. The fixed method doesn't throw any warnings or errors and passes the test as required.

This bug affects the module where the flags for the compiler are being set and can potentially affect other modules that depend on these flags or the 'createOptions' method.
